title: IE8 Bug in bitwise operators for JavaScript
description:
This will be a very quick entry: I just wanted to report a bug I discovered in IE8 that I could not find any information about. IE8 appears to have a bug with its bitwise operators in JavaScript (right shift, unsigned right shift, and bitwise or â€“ maybe more). The bug is: whenever the left operand is greater or equal to 2^63, the operator returns zero.

In other words, if the operand has its high bit set when converted to uint64, these operators will return 0 instead of their correct value.
